data.title: Making your own fun: what cruising was like in the '60s and '70s
data.meta_description: In a more innocent era before onboard climbing walls, wave pools and Michelin dining, it was down to cruise passengers to make the most of their time at sea.
data.text:
Helen Hutcheon

Jul 24, 2019 – 2.08pm

EmailLinkedInTwitterFacebook

Subscribe to gift this article

Gift 5 articles to anyone you choose each month when you subscribe.

Subscribe now

Already a subscriber?

I’ve spent many a Christmas at sea. I’ve spent many a New Year’s Eve at sea, along with too many birthdays to count. I even met my husband at sea, back in 1966, aboard P & O’s Arcadia.

I began my working life in 1956 with a cadetship on a shipping magazine, and I now work for the British-based Seatrade Cruise Review and Seatrade Cruise News as the Australia, New Zealand and South Pacific regional correspondent.
